columns.name: Unnamed: 0
columns.meaning: Row identifier or index column used to uniquely identify each record in the dataset.
columns.why_used: Used as a unique identifier to reference specific rows and maintain data integrity.

columns.name: age
columns.meaning: Age in years, representing the age of individuals in the dataset.
columns.why_used: Used for demographic segmentation, age-based customer profiling, and age-related trend analysis.

columns.name: job
columns.meaning: Job title or occupation category Common values: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for job-based segmentation, career analysis, and occupational grouping.

columns.name: marital
columns.meaning: Marital status of individuals (e.g., single, married, divorced).
columns.why_used: Used for demographic analysis, customer segmentation, and lifestyle profiling.

columns.name: education
columns.meaning: Education level or qualification Examples: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for educational background analysis and qualification-based segmentation.

columns.name: default
columns.meaning: Boolean indicator showing whether the customer defaulted on payment (yes/no).
columns.why_used: Used as a target variable for default prediction models and credit risk analysis.

columns.name: housing
columns.meaning: Boolean indicator showing housing loan status (yes/no).
columns.why_used: Used to identify customers with housing loans for financial product segmentation and risk assessment.

columns.name: loan
columns.meaning: Boolean indicator showing whether a loan was approved or not (yes/no).
columns.why_used: Used to filter and segment customers based on loan approval status for risk analysis and targeting.

columns.name: contact
columns.meaning: Boolean flag indicating true/false or yes/no values (e.g., 0, 1).
columns.why_used: Used for binary classification, filtering, and conditional segmentation in predictive modeling.

columns.name: month
columns.meaning: Month of the year Examples: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: day_of_week
columns.meaning: Day of the week Examples: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: campaign
columns.meaning: Categorical feature with 5 distinct values. Common values: 1, 2, 3.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: pdays
columns.meaning: Day-related categorical feature.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: previous
columns.meaning: Categorical feature with 8 distinct values. Common values: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: poutcome
columns.meaning: Categorical feature with 3 distinct values. Common values: 0, 1, 2.
columns.why_used: Used for grouping, filtering, and categorical analysis to identify patterns across different categories.

columns.name: emp_var_rate
columns.meaning: Numerical score or rating value for evaluation.
columns.why_used: Used for quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and measurable attribute evaluation.

columns.name: cons_price_idx
columns.meaning: Monetary or quantitative amount in currency or unit terms.
columns.why_used: Used for quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and measurable attribute evaluation.

columns.name: cons_conf_idx
columns.meaning: Numeric measurement representing a quantifiable value.
columns.why_used: Used for quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and measurable attribute evaluation.

columns.meaning: Numeric measurement representing a quantifiable value.
columns.why_used: Used for quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and measurable attribute evaluation.

columns.name: nr_employed
columns.meaning: Numeric measurement representing a quantifiable value.
columns.why_used: Used for quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and measurable attribute evaluation.

columns.name: y
columns.meaning: Boolean flag indicating true/false or yes/no values (e.g., 0, 1).
columns.why_used: Used for binary classification, filtering, and conditional segmentation in predictive modeling.
